member.name: T:SharpMap.Layers.GeoTransform
member.summary:
The coefficients for transforming between pixel/line (X,Y) raster space, and projection coordinates (Xp,Yp) space.
Xp = T[0] + T[1]*X + T[2]*Y
Yp = T[3] + T[4]*X + T[5]*Y
In a north up image, T[1] is the pixel width, and T[5] is the pixel height. The upper left corner of the upper left pixel is at position (T[0],T[3]).

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: converts image point into projected point

member.summary: converts image point into projected point

member.summary: returns value of the transform array

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.SqlLite.CreateDataTable(SharpMap.Data.Providers.IProvider,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new table in a Microsoft SQL Server database and copies rows from an existing datasource.

remarks.para: The datatable created will contain six extra columns besides the attribute data: "OID" (Object ID row), "WKB_Geometry" (Geometry stored as WKB), and Envelope_MinX, Envelope_MinY, Envelope_MaxX, Envelope_MaxY for geometry bounding box.

member.param: Name of table to create (existing table will be overwritten!)
member.returns: Number or rows inserted, -1 if failed and 0 if table created but no rows inserted.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.Oracle
member.summary: Oracle dataprovider

remarks.para: This provider needs the Oracle software client installed on the PC where the application runs. If you need to connect to an Oracle database, it has to have oracle client (or Oracle Instant Client) installed.
You can download Oracle Client here: http://www.oracle.com/technology/software/index.html
If client don4t need an instance of Oracle, a better option is to use Oracle Instant client http://www.oracle.com/technology/tech/oci/instantclient/index.html
SharpMap Oracle provider by Humberto Ferreira (humbertojdf at hotmail com).

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.DataTablePoint
member.summary: The DataTablePoint provider is used for rendering point data from a System.Data.DataTable.

remarks.para: The data source will need to have two double-type columns, xColumn and yColumn that contains the coordinates of the point, and an integer-type column containing a unique identifier for each row.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DataTablePoint provider
member.param: Instance of to use as data source.
Name of column where point's X value is stored.
Name of column where point's Y value is stored.
